Class GraphFrame

java.lang.Object

                                |
                                +--it.GraphFrame
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.WindowConstants, XYValWatcher
public class GraphFrame
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements XYValWatcher

The GraphFrame class provides an environment for the GraphPanel class. Class users do not have to strictly use this class to be able to use the GraphPanel class, which provides the actual drawing context for the graphs.

See Also:

Method Detail

setAxes

public void setAxes(double xMin,
                    double xMax,
                    double yMin,
                    double yMax)
Changes the axes of the graph frame. Called by individual graphs.

getAxisValues

public double[] getAxisValues()
Returns the axis values as an array of doubles: xMin, xMax, yMin, yMax respectively.

setAxisLabels

public void setAxisLabels(java.lang.String xLabel,
                          java.lang.String yLabel)
Sets the axis labels to the given strings.
Parameters:
xLabel - label for x axis
yLabel - label for y axis

addGraph

public void addGraph(Graphable graph)
Convenience method that calls the addGraph method in GraphPanel. This method causes the graphable object to be added to the list of graphs to be drawn in the controlled GraphPanel object of this frame.
Parameters:
graph - the graphable object to be added to GraphPanel

removeGraph

public boolean removeGraph(Graphable graph)
Convenience method that calls the removeGraph method in GraphPanel. This method causes the graphable object to be removed from the list of graphs to be drawn in the controlled GraphPanel object of this frame.
Parameters:
graph - the graphable object to be removed from GraphPanel

getGraphs

public java.util.Enumeration getGraphs()
Gets an enumeration of the graphs in the GraphPanel object. This enumeration can be iterated through as the user wishes after casting the call to Enumeration.nextValue() to a Graphable object.

updateStatusBar

public void updateStatusBar(java.lang.String message)
Called by the graph panel to update information for the user on events such as resize etc.

updateXYVals

public void updateXYVals(java.lang.String x,
                         java.lang.String y)
The right hand side of the status bar displays the mouse coordinate values in graph space and not in screen coordinate space. Can be used to garner actual values from the displayed graphs.
Specified by:
updateXYVals in interface XYValWatcher
Following copied from interface: it.XYValWatcher
Parameters:
xval - String representation of x in graph space
yval - String representation of y in graph space

getNewValue

protected final void getNewValue(java.lang.String message,
                                 byte axisval)
This method shows a dialog that prompts the user for a value for the new extremis of an axis. If the value is a proper number the method then calls the setAxisValue( ... ) method with the appropriate information and this method determines whether the values are within bounds. Bad values or out-of-bounds are ignored.
Parameters:
message - the prompt to display in the dialog box
axisval - the axis value to be set (XMIN, XMAX, YMIN, YMAX)

getNewLabel

protected final void getNewLabel(java.lang.String message,
                                 byte whichAxis)
This method shows a dialog that prompts the user for a new label of an axis. If the input is not null, the method then calls the setAxisLabel( ... ) method with the appropriate information.
Parameters:
message - the prompt to display in the dialog box
whichAxis - the axis whose label is to be set (XAXISLABEL, YAXISLABEL)

pushChanges

protected void pushChanges()
Called from Graphable or any of its subclasses in response to any change in graph information. In response, it calls repaint() on graphPanel so that the display can be updated and the new information displayed.

deleteAllGraphs

public void deleteAllGraphs()
Calls GraphPanel's deleteAllGraphs() to delete all the graphs currently displayed on the GraphPanel. Convenience method for applications such as the ODE Solver.
